quote_first: The ‘night train’ tallied to perfection, for high tide in the creek would be, as Davies estimated, between 10.30 and 11.00 p.m.on the night of the 25th; and the time-table showed that the only night train arriving at Norden was one from the south at
title: The Riddle of the Sands
author: Erskine Childers

quote_first: OLIVE: [At KATHERINE’S elbow—examining her watch on its stand] It’s
quote_last:
.
KATHERINE: Olive, Olive!
OLIVE: I just wanted to see the time. I never can go to sleep if I try—it’s quite helpless, you know. Is there a victory yet? [KATHERINE, shakes her head] Oh! I prayed extra special for one in the evening papers.
title: The Mob
author: John Galsworthy
